title: PC firm price above equilibrium, sells nothing

content.question: If a perfectly competitive firm increases its price above the market equilibrium price, which of the following will be true for this firm?

choices.label: Its sales will decrease but profit will not be affected.
Its demand curve will become downward sloping.
It will not be able to sell any output.

content.answer: It will not be able to sell any output.

unit.text: 3: Production, Cost, and the Perfect Competition Model

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
